title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have $41 million in cap space for the offseason, targeting potential free agent signings.
Colts WR Alec Pierce, Packers OT Rasheed Walker cited as potential free agents to address Patriots' needs.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely, Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips considered strategic signings for future team improvements.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes MLB.TV's new streaming home, offering an add-on subscription for $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can buy MLB.TV for $149.99, with a free month trial of ESPN Unlimited included.
Current MLB.TV subscribers will auto-renew and can stream games on both the MLB and ESPN apps.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics, fueling speculation of his potential return this season.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's performance, stating he looked like himself during the practice.
Tatum remains on the Celtics' injured list following an Achilles injury, with no confirmed timetable for his return.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in WalletHub's 2026 report, leading in higher education attainment.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, and nearly 22% have a graduate or professional degree.
Vermont and Maryland ranked second and third, respectively, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked last.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The rare Honus Wagner T206 baseball card is up for auction, expecting to sell for over $4.7 million.
The card, discovered by the Shields family, has remained with them for 116 years, originally found in a cigarette pack.
Auction ends Feb. 21, led by Ken Goldin, whose Netflix series 'King of Collectibles' features the Wagner card's unique history.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut as starting goalie for Team USA against Denmark on Saturday.
Swayman, 27, has been crucial in past tournaments, leading USA to an IIHF World Championship in 2025.
Bruins' defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also play, joining Swayman on Team USA in the 2026 Winter Olympics.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found dead off Virginia's Eastern Shore, identified by the New England Aquarium.
This marks the second right whale death in two weeks, following a 4-year-old male's death off North Carolina.
With around 380 individuals left, entanglements and vessel strikes are major threats to the critically endangered species.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven pediatric flu deaths reported in Massachusetts this season, part of 260 total influenza-related fatalities.
Flu activity peaked in January causing hospital strain; cases now declining but flu still present in the state.
Health officials encourage vaccinations, especially for children, seniors, and those with underlying health conditions.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department invites residents to report exes with warrants via a Valentine-themed Facebook post.
The humorous post urges tips on exes' locations with promises of 'a ride with flashing lights.'
Over 7,000 Facebook likes and 400 comments reflect community amusement at the unique warrant reminder.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer are candidates for the Red Sox's third base position as spring training begins.
Both Durbin and Mayer will practice at second and third base, alternating positions during drills.
Manager Alex Cora aims to solidify the Red Sox's infield positions, including third base, before the season starts.
